did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Frank Cheyne Papé Letters and drawings ,

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Stanford University. Libraries. Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation:
prefercite.p: [Identification of item] Frank Cheyne Papé Letters and drawings , M0296, Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Letters and invoices (1929-1931) written or directed to Alwyn J. Scheuer. The letters concern orders for illustrations, prices, and shipping. The collection also includes 194 drawings by Papé, illustrations for seven works published between 1921 and 1930.

did.unittitle: Norman Strouse Gift May, 1977Letters of Frank C. Pape

scopecontent.p: Frank Cheyne Pape 1878- Br. illustrator 13 letters and 6 invoices 1929-31 all written or directed to Alwyn J. Scheuer.

did.unittitle: Letters (All business orders for illus., prices, shipping, also of illustrated books.).
1. 10/1/29Percy House St. John's Rd, Tumbridge Wells. Eng. FCP to AJS 26E 56th St. NYC.

scopecontent.p: re: sales and prices of his illustrations and illustrated books.

did.unittitle: 2. 5/10/30FCP to AJS re: illus., mentions books by Cabell and France.
* 9. 7/24/31.Bury House hr. Palborough, Sussex. John Galsworthy to NS.
2. 4/17/31FCP to AJS ADS rept. of payment for Jurgens bks 2 orig. vignettes for d.
3. 4/18/31FCP to AJS ADS 1/2 p. invoice for closed vignette for Jurgens.
4. NDFCP to AJS ADS 1/2 rcpt. vignettes for Jurgen, Cream of Jest, & Figures of Earth.
5. NDFCP to [AJS] AD w/ ANS 3/4 p. book price list and note re: Am. ed. Silver Stallion.
6. 4/18/31.FCP to [AJS] ANS 1/2 p. re: returning book.
7. NDFCP to AJS ADS 3/4 p. invoice for colored original - title page Cream of the Jest.
FRANK PAPÉ ILLUSTRATED BOOKS in the NORMAN H. STROUSE COLLECTION

FRANCE, Anatole, Penguin Island. Translated by A.H. Evans With Illustrations and Decorations by Frank C. Papé. 8vo. 1st illustrated edition. 4 doublepage endleaves, front and back, 12 full page illustrations, 1 half-title, 1 heading, 8 full page titlepages to Sections, 45 tailpieces, 55 decorated initials. Black cloth binding, gilt-stamped with Papé designs. London. John Lane. Bodley Head. (1925)

scopecontent.p: Only 1 original drawing for this book in the collection - the half-title.
NO original drawings in the collection for the following three books.

did.unittitle: FRANCE, Anatole. The Well of St. Claire. Translated by Alfred Allison with Illustrations and Decorations by Frank C. Papé. 8vo. 1st illustrated edition. 4 doublepage endleaves, front and back, 12 full page illustrations, numerous tailpieces and decorated initials. Black cloth binding, gilt stamped with Pape designs. Bookplate of Marjorie and H.D. Phillips. London. John Lane Bodley Head. (1928)

FRANCE, Anatole. Mother of Pearl. Translated by Frederick Chapmen with Illustrations and Decorations by Frank C. Papé. 8vo. 1st illustrated editio 4 double page endleaves, frent and back, 12 full page illustrations, numerous tailpieces and decorated intials. Original dust jacket with Papo designs. London. John Lane. Bodley Head. (1929)

CABELL, James Branch. Domnei, a Comedy of Woman-Worship. Illustrated by Frank C. Papé. 8vo. 1st illustrated edition. With full page black and white illustrations to many chapters as well as the 12 photogravures, 4 double page endleaves front and back. Black cloth binding, gilt stamped with Pape designs. London. John Lane. Bodley Head. (1930)

scopecontent.p: The Strouse collection includes (by actual count of the drawings) - 194 original Frank Pape drawings. The detailed descriptions in the following pages show the many repetitions. Also, the artist frequently separated parts of the drawings and used then individually - thus the detail descriptions of the drawings and the actual count of the originals do not make a tally.
Revolt of the Angels 22 original drawings

did.unittitle: FRANK PAPÉ ORIGINAL DRAWINGS in the Norman H. Strouse Collection from Figures OF Earth

CABELL, James Branch, Figures of Earth, a Comedy of Appearences. With Illustrations and Decorations by Frank C. Pape. The 5 sections dedicated to Sinclair Lewis, Louis Untermeyer, H.L. Hencken, Hugh Walpole and Joseph Hergesheimer. 8vo, 1st illustrated edition. With 12 full page illustrations, double page decorated endpapers, front and back, 5 decorated full page section heads, 1 heading, 40 decorated chapter initials, and 31 elaborately drawn tailpieces. Black cloth binding, gilt stamped with Pape designs, and original dust jocket with Papé decorations. London. John Lane, Bodley Head. (1925)Bookplate of Marjorie and H.D. Phillips.

scopecontent.p: Copy 2 - as above except no dust jacket or bookplate

did.physloc: Title page to Section II Opp. p. 72

did.unittitle: I am also... Stork retrieving babies

scopecontent.p: Small medallion decoration on titlepage (drawing missing)

did.unittitle: Bust of Manuel between two pigs.

scopecontent.p: The book has 31 claboratoly decorated tailpieces varying from 1/8 to 3/4 of a page in size - but NO tailpiece original drawings are included in the collection.
Colored titlpager(13 3/4 x 9¼ inches) in included in the original drawings but was not used in the book.
No decorated initials were included with the drawings.
TOTAL 25 original drawings. The detailed descriptions of the drawings, the repetition, and the separation of parts therefore does not tally with the actual count of the original drawings.

did.unittitle: FRANK PAPE ORIGINAL DRAWINGS in the Norman H. Strouse COLLECTION From JURGEN

CABELL, James Branch. Jurgen, a Comedy of Justice with Illustrations and DECORATIONS by Frank C. Pape And an Introduction by Hugh Walpole.1st illustrated edition, limited to 3000 copies. With frontispiece in color, 13 full page illustrations, double-page decorated end-papers, front and back, 50 decorated chapter initials, 1 heading, and 46 tail-piece decorations. Black cloth binding, gilt-stamped with Pape designs. Original dust jacket, also decorated. London. John Lane. Bodley Head. 1921.

scopecontent.p: Copy 2, exactly as above bat lacking dust jacket. Has Waldo F. Stone bookplate.
Strouse collection has all original drawings but 1 full page illustration (facing page 10, and these two sped...), lacks 7 tailpieces and all initial drawings.
The Strouse collection has a total of 52 original Frank Papé drawings for Jurgen. Only 7 tailpieces are missing (two are repeated numerous times) and only one full page illustration is lacking.
TOTAL 35 original 1 drawings. The detailed description of the drawings, their repetition, and the separation of many parts, therefore does not tally with the actual count of the original drawings.

did.unittitle: FRANK PAPÉ ORIGINAL DRAWINGS in the NORMAN H. STROUSE COLLECTION From RABELAIS

RABELAIS, Francois. The Complete Works... Being an Account of the Inestimable Life of the Great Gargantua, and of the Heroic Deeds, Sayings, and Marvelous Voyages of Has Son the Good Pantagruel: the Whole Faithfully Rendered into English by Sir Thomas [UNK] and Peter Motteux, with Annotations by Duohat, Ozell, and others.A New Introduction by J. Lewis May, and Many Illustrations by Frank C. Papé. 8vo. 2 vols. Ltd. to 4300 sets. Vol.I has 12 full page illustrations, 1 heading, 1 decorative initial, 2 full page, decorated titlepages to Sections I and II, and 86 tailpieces. Vol. II has 13 full page illustrations, 3 section titlepages, 1 heading, 1 decorated initial, and 144 tailpieces. Black cloth bindings, gilt stamped with Papé designs. London. John Lane. Bodley Head, 1927.

scopecontent.p: All full page original drawings are missing from the Strouse collection, The book does not have decorated endleaves but there are two full size original drawings which could have been projected for endleaves and not used in the Volume.

note.p: Prints with checks (Rabelais only) are in our collection

did.physdesc: 2 full page titlepages to Books II and III (original drawings missing)

scopecontent.p: TOTAL original Papé drawings for Rabelais in Strouse collection... Vol. I
2 full page title pages to sections

did.unittitle: RABELAIS - Volume II - Original Pape Drawings in Strouse Collection

scopecontent.p: The 13 full page original drawings are missing from the Strouse collection
The volume does not have decorated endleaves.
Two full page titlepages to Sections IV and V are not included. in drawings.

TOTAL original Pape drawings for RABELAIS in Strouse collection... VOL. II. The word missing refers only to original drawings. All illustrations are intact in books themselves. Many of the Tailpieces are repeated from Volume I and their original drawings are included with Volume I collection.
2 full page title pagedrawings for sections 4 and 5 missing.

TOTAL 55 original drawings. The detailed description of the drawings, their frequent repetition, and the separate appearance of the many parts, therefore does not tally with the actual count of the original drawings.

did.unittitle: FRANK PAPÉ ORIGINAL DRAWINGS in the NORMAN H. STROUSE Collection from AT THE SIGH OF THE REINE PEDAUQUE

FRANCE, Anatole. At The Sign of the Reine Pedauque. Translated by Mrs. Wilfred Jackson with Illustrations and Decorations by Frank C. Papé and an Introduction by William J. Lacke. 8vo. 1st illustrated edition. With double page decorated endleaves, front and back, 12 full page illustrations, 1 decorated half-title, 1 heading, 21 tail-pieces, and 30 decorated initiale. Black cloth binding, gilt-stamped with Pape designs. London. John Lane. Bodley Head. (1922)

scopecontent.p: Copy 2 - exactly alike but is 1923 reprint with original dust-jacket, decorated in red with Papé designs. PRESENTATION COPY to Walter M. Hill, with original pen drawing tipped in preceding half-title.
(no original initial drawings in collection. These were not included with any of the original drawings)
7 drawings for full page illustrations (4 missing)
32 original drawings for La Reine Pedauque in Strouse Collection
no half title drawing in collection
none of the 30 initial drawings in collection - but this was usual.

TOTAL 33 original drawings. The detailed description of the drawings, their frequent repetition, and the separation of the many parts, therefore does not tall with the actual count of the original drawings.

did.unittitle: FRANK PAPE ORIGINAL DRAWINGS in the Norman H. STROUSE COLLECTION From THE REVOLT OF THE ANGELS

FRANCE, Anatole. The Revolt of the Angels. Translated by Mrs. Wilfred Jackson with Illustrations and Decorations by Frank C. Pape. 8vo. 1st illus. sdeition. With 12 full page illustrations, double page decorated endpapers at front and back, 1 heading, 28 el boratoly decorated tailpieces, decorated halftitle, and 30 decorated initials. Black cloth binding, gilt-stamped with Pape designs. London. John Lane. Bodley Head. c.1924

scopecontent.p: Copy 2. Same as Copy 1 except for American publisher's imprint (Dodd, Head) in gold on backstrip.

Only one full page illustration - original drawing - in collection, Istar opposite page 118 - others (10) missing. The word missing refers only original drawings. All illustrations in books themselves, are intact. No decorated initials for any of the Pape editions are included in the original drawings of the collection.

TOTAL 22 original drawings. The detailed description of the drawings, their frequent repetitions, and the separation of any parts, therefore does not tally with the actual count of the original drawings.

did.unittitle: owl and book hanging in BR.

scopecontent.p: The Strouse Collection has a total of 25 original drawings by Frank Pape for THE REVOLT OF THE ANGELS. These include only 1 full page illustration (there are 12 in book). The double endleaves count as 4. The drawing for the half-title, and drawing for the heading are present. 18 original drawings of tailpieces are present (the book includes 28). There are no deocrated initials.

did.unittitle: FRANK PAPÉ ORIGINAL DRAWINGS in the NORMAN H. STROUSE COLLECTION From THAIS

FRANCE, Anato IE. Thais. A Translation by Robert B. Douglas with Illustrations and Decorations by Frank C. Papé. 8vo. With 12 full page illustrations, 5 full page decorations preceding Parts, double-page decorated end-papers, front and back, 4 decorated tailpieces to Parts, decorated half-title, and five decorated initials preceding Parts. Black cloth binding, gilt stamped with Pape designs. London. John Lane. Bodley Head. (1930)

scopecontent.p: Strouse Collection has all original drawings for this book except the 5 initials.

did.unittitle: The Lotus - monk, angels, Thais, dragon - border
The Papyrus - child, Thais, Nubian slave, heaven.
The Papyrus-Paphnutius leads Thais through desert.
The Euphorbia - Thais upon her bier.
pictorially designed for head of text for each section

scopecontent.p: The Strouse Collection has a total of 26 original Frank Pape drawings for THAIS. The only drawings not present are the five initial designs. These donot seem to be included with any of the original collections.

TOTAL 23 original drawings. The detailed description of the drawings, their frequent repetition, and the separation of the many parts, therefore does not tally with the actual count of the original drawings.
